overview:
Adam has worked at technology companies such as Oracle, Actuate, and Google before starting his career as an entrepreneur in 2006.

Adam left Google in 2006 to start an advertising analytics company called ClearSaleing. Adam is largely responsible for advancing the field of advertising measurement by creating a method to track and measure the impact all of the ads a consumer clicks and sees that lead to a conversion. This field is better known as attribution management. After growing the business for 5 years ClearSaleing was sold to GSI Commerce. Shortly after the sale, GSI Commerce was sold to eBay, making ClearSaleing an eBay company.

Adam stayed with ClearSaleing for 7 more months after the sale then left to pursue other opportunities. Currently Adam is working on his newest start-up called OffersBy.Me.
